sys_metadata_link.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_0586_til_post">
    <x_0586_til_post action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE">
        <category display_value="Tricks">a8c6c0be1b8154908ed631d7dc4bcbef</category>
        <github_id>117</github_id>
        <github_url>https://github.com/iamkalai/SNTIL/issues/117</github_url>
        <message>You may or may not know this but if you want to determine if an script or object is OOB, one of the easiest way is checking sys_upgrade_history_log table. You can query the table with condition like filename as tablename_sysid. The table also has a plugin field, which you can use to determine the plugin that added this object.
```javascript
var gr = new GlideRecord("sys_upgrade_history_log");
gr.addEncodedQuery("file_name=sys_script_include_6f320f190bc70300acc30e7363673af8");
gr.setLimit(1);
gr.query();
if (gr.next()) {
    gs.print(gr.getLink());
}
```</message>
        <number>TIL0001123</number>
        <status>old</status>
        <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by>
        <sys_created_on>2022-05-09 15:19:37</sys_created_on>
        <sys_id>92c16aea2f9fcd5051dad5f62799b6fc</sys_id>
        <sys_mod_count>3</sys_mod_count>
        <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by>
        <sys_updated_on>2022-05-12 09:07:20</sys_updated_on>
        <title>Check if object is OOB and which plugin it belongs.</title>
    </x_0586_til_post>
</record_update>
